p: The final analyses examine the sensitivity of the results to the weightings used. This is examined for the changing climate under the A2 scenario for the mid-century with constant demographic and socioeconomic data. The weightings of 25%, 40% and 35% are assigned to exposure to intense rain events, demographic structure and socio-economic wellbeing respectively. The results are then compared with results from Experiment 2 which is identically premised but with equal weightings. The weightings are premised on the study of [ 31] who suggest similar percentages for climate versus non-climate exposure and resilience sub-indices, based on literature review and a series of discussions with experts actively involved in developing useful adaptation and mitigation strategies for addressing climate change.
